21.36. Kropholler’s hierarchy (see 15.45) is closed under finite extensions, that is, (HαF)F ⊆ HαF for every α (P. Kropholler, J. Pure Appl. Algebra, 90 (1993), 55–67). Let a hierarchy of tdlc groups HK be defined analogously to Kropholler’s hierarchy in 15.45, with K being the class of profinite groups and with the cell stabilisers of the admissible action required to be open.
Is it true that HK is closed under profinite extensions, that is, (HαK)K ⊆ HαK for every α?
G. C. Cook
